ol.li: Conforms to CDA Observation
SHALL contain [1..1] @moodCode = "EVN"
SHALL contain [1..*] id

SHOULD contain [1..1] effectiveTime
Represents the biologically relevant time (e.g. time the specimen was obtained from the patient).
SHALL contain [1..1] statusCode
SHALL contain [1..1] code

MAY contain [0..1] methodCode
Included if the method isn't inherent in code or if there is a need to further specialize the method in code.

SHOULD contain [0..*] interpretationCode
Can be used to provide a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation, such as 'N' (normal), 'L' (low), 'S' (susceptible), etc. Interpretation is generally provided for numeric results where an interpretation range has been defined, or for antimicrobial susceptibility test interpretation.
SHALL contain [1..1] value

SHOULD satisfy: The value for 'code' SHOULD be selected from LOINC (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) or SNOMED CT (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96), and MAY be selected from CPT-4 (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.12).
SHALL satisfy: The methodCode SHALL NOT conflict with the method inherent in code
SHALL satisfy: Where value is a physical quantity, the unit of measure SHALL be expressed using a valid Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) expression.
SHOULD satisfy: Contain one or more referenceRange to show the normal range of values for the observation result
SHALL satisfy: SHALL NOT contain referenceRange / observationRange / code, as this attribute is not used by the HL7 Clinical Statement or Lab Committee models.
SHALL satisfy: Contains one or more sources of information.
